column4: anyone have any experience with fwbuilder? i'm trying to install it on a brand new 6.06 server install, and i'm not smarter than the package
libfwbuilder depends on libc6 (>= 2.5-0ubuntu1); however: Version of libc6 on system is 2.3.6-0ubuntu20.5 <-- how can i fix that?
you are most likely installing an application from a higher Ubuntu version.
you'd need to upgrade that libc package as well, though I strongly advice against that.
so i can't get updated? do i have to go get the latest version, or is there a path without reinstalling this box?
what's the package in question?
the first thing you should do is look for a backport.
the one i'm attempting to install? fwbuilder (available at http://www.fwbuilder.org )
it's breaking when i try to install the required libfwbuilder package
are you using Feisty?
no, i'm using 6.06 server, figured the LTS would be a good option
would you recommend i reload clean from the 7.04 server iso?
there's fwbuilder 2.0.9 in dapper, you should perfectly be able to use that.
With Feisty all you seem to get in terms of fwbuilder is a tiny upgrade.
http://packages.ubuntu.com/cgi-bin/search_packages.pl?keywords=fwbuilder&searchon=names&subword=1&version=all&release=all
omg... ok, how do i get it to find/install that?
just enable the universe repository in your server and install fwbuilder
you know how to enable repositories and install software in Ubuntu?
please forgive my ignorance, but how do i enable the universe repository? i'm running without a GUI here, and i'm a bit lost
!repository | umop-apisdn
thanks, now i have a direction to flail in ;)
you need to follow the command-line approach
there you go
if you follow Scunizi short-cut without reading the wiki entry, don't forget to "sudo apt-get update" as well.
